one_reviews_text: I like a game that has a story line with levels and free movement. but if you like arcade this for you

Love this game. I was worried I wouldn't enjoy it that much because it was a wave shooter, but the strategy involved makes this excellent. I'm not very big on RPGs and loot collecting, so the gun/upgrade system in this was great. Quick and easy yet still very fun. Me and my friend had a blast taking turns trying to beat the missions together. Highly recommend.

I bought this game in sale for £15 a few months ago. I was imeditely very impressed at the gameplay, graphics and mechanics, this game is extreemly fun and awesome to play, I put off buying this game for a very long time, I wanted it for over a year but didn't want to paỳ full price. I wish now I had bought it earlier as it's really great.

Just one thing though, each planet has like 4-5 waves, when I tried the first two planets I could use a whole range of weapons, lots of differant awesome guns, but then when I got to the 3rd, 4th and 5th planet it only let me use a sword, sniper rifle and shield? And I really don't like those weapons, I only want to play with the guns, rifles, shotguns, machine guns, rocket launcher, pistols etc, how can I play planet 3, 4, 5 with those weapons?

If it's not possible then that's dissapointing as that means theres only two planets for me to play on which is not enough levels? I would expect at least 10 levels/planets to play on?

review_title: i bought it, and cant play it.
one_reviews_text: Issue saying Failed to initialize SSL... tons of people getting this issue.

if you like arcadey wave shooters, gore, and guns, well this is yet another shooter to add to your bucket list. maybe you'll love it. 

but in my opinion, there are already oh so many shooters out there with more depth to them than this, i just don't understand why people like this so much? i bought this game before gunheart because i read reviews saying it was better, but gunheart was wayyyy more interesting and engaging. 

this is not a roomscale game. you stand in one spot and shoot various hordes of the exact same monster coming towards you. 
i'm not saying it's bad, just not what i wanted.

Can't stop playing, very funny, intense and well done !!!
Of course 5 stars !!

This is my current favorite game. Lots of "fun factor". 

This game requires more strategy than just good aim. You have an awesome assortment of weapons to choose from and there is also a wide variety of different kinds of enemies that come at you. And certain weapons are best against certain enemies. So you have to be smart about which weapon you use throughout the mission, switching constantly as the oncoming enemies change, and to save ammo in that weapon for the next time you'll need it. In a particluar mission, the oncoming waves of enemies are not random. Where and when and what enemies appear during that particular mission is predetermined. So you have to learn and develope the strategy you are going to use to beat that mission. This is what keeps the game from being dull. When you first start a mission you will die shortly by a seamingly impossible onslaught of bad guys. But with each renewed atempt you will learn, for example to first shoot that skeleton with your bow, switch to explosive arrows to destroy the incoming helecopters to your left, then quickly look to your right while switching to your minigun to take out the oncoming flood of spiders and then quickly activating Slow Time, one of your dozen special abilities, just as the flying insects come into view at 12 o'clock, take them out with the minigun and then switch to your rifle to take out the snipers that already spawned in the distance, etc etc etc. Once you think you have the strategy figured out you progress a little further into the mission and realize that you need more ammo in your plasma gun for the enemies that just killed you. So you need to figure out how you are going to change your current action plan so that you conserve plasma ammo for later on, etc etc. Trust me, its addicting and fun!

review_title: A very funny and crazy game
one_reviews_text:
It is clear that you can make a good game of waves, SERIOUS SAM is a very good game with many improvements and a very funny multiplayer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FYV1Y9q12Do

One of the very best out there - lotsa weapons and powerups. Great variety in enemies and environments, and it all looks really good. You unlock weapon upgrades, and nodes in a skill-tree as you complete levels, which is needed (for me at least) to defeat the levels on the "Serious" difficulty.

The forced use of the bow is what degrades my scores from 4 to 3 stars. It's such a gimmicky weapon that shouldn't be necessary to master in a Serious Sam title.

This is pure unadulterated fun!  Great sound and graphics, tons of polish, many difficulty levels, adrenaline pumping, just plain insane!  I am uninstalling all my other wave shooters, because after this why bother?

review_title: Not working. Ask for login credentials
one_reviews_text: As you can see on many posts on Steam this game does not work anymore if it was bought in the Rift Store.

I was under the impression, perhaps hopefully, that this was a run and gun kind of game. Instead, you stand there, and shoot at waves.
That's disappointing.
However, the upgrade system, and the fluidity with which the game performs is fantastic.
The difficulty level is a little high, but I can see that it is meant to be that way so you build up your arsenal and upgrades so content becomes less hard as you go along, and you start unlocking higher difficulties.
The mechancis are good, the system of gameplay is good.

The depth of interest and playability is low. 
The same thing happens constantly, and in the same order.
Which is nice, because you are able to mitigate the difficulty by becoming familiar with spawns.
But it isn't nice because... no element of surprise after a while.

Overall, I think the price point is too high for the content.
but the VR port is very badly made
Have not been able to play the game yet because it will not start.  It errors instantly and the Croteam error report can't be sent. Also, there's not way to get help or support.

Get the other versions on STEAM instead.  This game was a waste of my money as it feels like some coding studing took some assetts from Serious Sam and built a wave shooter in 3 minutes.

If you've got a beast PC and you're able to stick all settings on Ultra (or higher!) with 300%+ resolutions, then this is one of the best looking VR games available. Yes, it's simple, but so are most VR games at this point. It's adrenaline fueled fun, pure and simple.

I wouldn't happily pay full price, but I paid less than full price and I'm happy with it.
Cream of the chop in every way!!!!
My family can play this without too much confusion and they really enjoy it!

Wow --- what great, wave shootin' fun!  HUGE props to CroTeam for staying with their creation.  They did not take the money and run after releasing Serious Sam.  The devs' devotion to excellent, ongoing updates, tweaks, fixes, and add ons went above and beyond the call of duty.  BTW, the graphics really (I mean REALLY!) pop BEEEYOOOTIFULLY when supersampled!  Thanks again, CroTeam, for staying with and nurturing your baby.

I am not able to invite friends to a game - I create a co-op and arena - When I pull up the menu and click "invite friends" nothing happens. When I go to join game - Nothing comes up. No servers available. 

...Very upset. It's been like this since purchase.

Croteam came through and finished the game, there is enough content to make this a solid purchase now.  Graphics are great and although the game play is just wave shooter it has a lot of variety with enemies and weapons.

This is one of the most fun VR games I've played and continue to play daily.  It's a wave shooter and no movement is required, you basically stand on the spot.  It's great fun. There is Multiplayer as well but finding someone to play with is hard, so add me to friends for a game.

This feels JUST like any other serious sam game, which we all know is great. There are so many game mechanics, such as variety of guns and gun upgrades, that make this game never get stale. It's very hard, but totally worth it. Haven't tried multiplayer yet, but this game for sure gets 5 stars.

If you loved Serious Sam then get this game!  This is a perfect VR recreation.  All the monsters you remember in a fantastic hectic playstyle just like the Serious Sam you remember.  Hordes of enemies coming at you and you have lots of guns with tons of ammo to deal with them.  This playstyle is exactly what Killing Floor as a PC game was and what the Oculus version should have been.  As disappointed as I was with Killing Floor, I'm elated with Serious Sam.

There is one negative.  As far as I can see, there are no "Player Slots" so multiple players can save their individual progression.  This is especially important when showing new players or if multple players use the same Oculus. 

If you loved Serious Sam, GET THIS GAME!

review_title: Nice game but just with guns!
one_reviews_text:
The first levels are great. Great weapons, cool opponents and also the whole atmosphere fits to Sam. I would give the game immediately 5 stars if the last updates were not so bad. So, the graphics of the worlds were again super and the opponents also but why I have no more reasonable weapons but am forced to play with sword or bow? It just does not fit into Sam and makes the new planets boring and bad for me. Please, dear developer, give me at least a pistol. ;-)

UPDATE June, 2017: Yes, the new Planet is nice again. You can choose also a gun if you dont like the bow. However, its a very hard Planet and the new Boss is really a big peace of a cake but hey, SAM IS BACK!! ;-)

By the way: You need Touch for it to make it perfect.

A lot of people will rip this game simply because it's a wave shooter, but to me there's a place for these types of games in VR. I personally love getting swarmed with stuff and struggle to kill it all with oversized weapons. For that type of experience, this game is probably the best.

I know that this is early access, so I won't harp on the quantity of content. The problem here is that, while the game is unquestionably gorgeous... it's just more tedious than it is fun. You stand in one place and shoot things... it lacks the creative gunplay of other VR games like Super Hot, while also being twice the price. And even more egregious, while the game technically supports co-op multiplayer, there are never any games available. Even if the game were complete, it would only be worth half of what it's listed. This is one time I wish I had purchased on Steam, where at least I could get a refund.

I was so looking forward to this. What a let down. Stand and shoot, why the hell have we gone back in time. 

Graphics OK worlds OK.
Standing NOT OK to anyone.

By far and out not the best shooter to date, static and stagnent and not indulging or emersive in any way. Steer clear unless you like mindless boring shooter

Once one gets over the initial early-adopters buzz of being in a three dimensional environment with weapons in your hands, you quickly realize this concept takes gaming back decades... despite its being in the Oculus Rift. 

Wave... after wave... after wave... of enemies. Naught else. Move along, nothin' to see here folks! (If you like shooters of the mindless variety, then you should love this!)
The arch need to improve. In the last update i can not press the "get" button, if i press it, the guns don´t shoot.

review_title: Very hard game. Arcade like shooter.
one_reviews_text: its hard as balls

This is a simple and direct example for how awesome Touch + Guns + VR = The Feels.

I'm not sure it's tuned quite right, yet, for the average or inexperienced player. 

If you reacted to that though with, "I will CRUSH your opinion!", this game will please you well. If you need some time to master VR as a combat paradigm, this game is a fine choice but be prepared for some frustration.

The update introduces a new planet, Shaanti, but the new weapons are a definite DOWNGRADE. First is a shotgun which you have to hold with both hands, squint down a sight in order to aim, and which largely blocks your view of everything (the old weapons worked fine without a sight). Second is the sword, which takes training, is hard to aim, and is tiring. A SWORD?? What century is this anyway??
This is a wave shooter without locomotion.  Serious Sam VR: The First Encounter, is the game you're looking for.

why cant i move? why cant i dodge? slick smooth framerate but you just stand there, thats it. you just stand there...... you just stand there. great tech demo, you made space pirate trainer but without the fun
I like the first two planets, i.e. the pure shooting experience. The third one with sword I don't really like.

review_title: Wow!! Best graphics Ive seen in VR.
one_reviews_text:
Hands down, best graphics. Super fun fast paced action shooting.. Im running a 6850k with SLI 1080s so having the graphics cranked all the way up definitely helps but holy hell I cant wait to see this game develop over time... Im in love with it.

For the people complaining about content, are you not familliar with what Early Access is? You are paying for an unfinished product... I assume most of you people have used steam before. Its the exact same concept. There will be more and more content added all the time.
great game, not crazy about update, dont like the sword or shotgun

review_title: Simple but solid, has scary moments
one_reviews_text: I'm new to Serious Sam and played through the Earth levels. Some of the enemies got really scary when they got right up in your face - the first time a bomber man hit me I actually screamed and my roommate came to check on me. The shooting feels good, alien designs are interesting, loads of enemies to shoot down without any dip in framerate, and the upgrade system is really solid. When you're spending money on ammo and health, it definitely raises the stakes for being efficient and careful. Only complaints are that I'm not a huge fan of the silly over-the-top macho protagonist, and the bosses are just bullet sponges that don't really show damage other than their meter. Overall it's a really simple but solid title.

review_title: Fun, but probably not for the price
one_reviews_text: I enjoyed previosu serious sam titles and was very excited about this VR experieince. The graphics are great and fights intense. There is little depth though, which is not suprising for a serious sam game. There is a little to much redundancy and fro $40 I'd expect more and hope that they will cotinue to added content. Right now its limited to just two zones with more on the way, so it maybe worth waiting to see how they continue to update.

Simply the best. Game is really difficult which  is good so you don't get bored easily. I ended up shooting with my arms completely extended. My left hand shooting one target and my right hand shooting a different target both completely apart from each other. My abilities and reaction times have improved a lot. Sometimes I had to pause because my index fingers get tired but it's ok. It would be good to be able to re-assign buttons so I could shoot with different buttons. Apart from that, I can't wait for other levels to come. Thanks a lot.
This insanely fun FPS will have you roaring with laughter or begging for mercy. Can't wait for the new levels!

A very immersive Touch experience with an intensity that can get cranked to the max as the horde of enemies nearly overwhelm you.  Fantastic start, looking forward to the updates!

UPDATE: It's been a while since the Steam version got its update, where's the update for the Oculus version?  Taking a star for taking your time, devs.

There's not a lot of depth here--just stand in one place in well rendered environments and shoot at waves and waves of aliens. The graphics are nice, and it's fun to have two giant guns in your hands, but Serious Sam could give us a bit more. It lacks some of the cheeky humor of the PC version of the game, and over time it can get a little boring just shooting and lots and lots of things racing toward you. Not a bad game to show off the power of the Touch controllers, however.

While not complete, they make it clear what to expect in the final product (5 planets with 4 "waves/stages" on each.  Right now, only the first two planets are available, but I can't wait for more!  This is the first game in a LONG time to capture the epic feeling of the final "Citadel" level of the original Serious Sam, and it manages to do so by the 4th level!  

The huge difference in difficulty settings may be off-putting for most.  Easy is too easy (to the point it doesn't feel challenging at all and I managed to clear everything without dying).  Normal feels about right other than the final wave of each planet.  The difficulty spike feels like it comes out of nowhere and I ended up dying quite a few times just at the boss.  Anything higher and you probably won't live long!  

Yes, you are stationary for each wave, and yes, instead of feeling like I was losing due to skill, it felt like I was losing due to lack of ammo, but every round felt very satisfying in the end.  This game will have regular play for me.  

New stuff is coming in the VERY near future.  They already announced (On November 24th) that a co-op mode, the third planet, and an unlockable skill-tree to aid progression is currently in testing.
5min and I'm board. To simple and to expensive! Not What it used to be.
